meanings.definition: The amount that has to be paid or spent to buy or obtain something.
meanings.sent1: The costs of the new phone were too high for me to afford.
meanings.sent2: She carefully calculated all the costs before making a decision.
meanings.sent3: The costs of going to the moon must be astronomical!
meanings.sent4: The costs of success often include hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent5: The costs of neglecting your health can be detrimental in the long run.

meanings.definition: An amount that is paid or spent to do or make something.
meanings.sent1: The costs of repairing the car were more than expected.
meanings.sent2: He considered the costs of starting a business before taking the leap.
meanings.sent3: The costs of eating too much ice cream are a stomachache.
meanings.sent4: The costs of procrastination can lead to missed opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The costs of kindness are always worth it in the end.

meanings.definition: To require the payment of (a specified sum of money) in order to be bought or obtained.
meanings.sent1: The store costs a lot of money to open and operate.
meanings.sent2: It costs a lot to maintain a large garden like hers.
meanings.sent3: It costs a pretty penny to buy a brand new car.
meanings.sent4: Losing a friend can cost you a piece of your heart.
meanings.sent5: It costs nothing to be kind to others and spread positivity.
